action.Description: Permit or Deny forwarding of matched packets. Valid values are `permit` and `deny`.

comment.Description: Descriptive comment, commonly used for approval workflows.

dstportfrom.Description: Destination port from. Valid values should be in range 1-65535

dstportgroup.Description: Match destination ports on a group of ports. Valid value name of ACL Port Group

dstportto.Description: Destination port to. Valid values should be in range 1-65535

established.Description: For TCP, also match reverse packets except with TCP SYN flag. For non-TCP, also generate a reverse rule with swapped source/destination. Valid values are `0` and `1`. Default value is `1`

icmptype.Description: Custom IPv4 ICMP code. Valid values should be in range 1-37 according to RFC 1700. Default value is `1`

name.Description: Unique name for the ACL entry.

proto.Description: IP protocol to match. Valid values are `all`, `ip`, `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, `icmpv6`.

reverse.Description: For TCP, also match reverse packets except with TCP SYN flag. For non-TCP, also generate a reverse rule with swapped source/destination. Default value is `true`

srcportfrom.Description: Source port from. Valid values should be in range 1-65535

srcportgroup.Description: Match source ports on a group of ports. Valid value name of ACL Port Group

srcportto.Description: Source port to. Valid values should be in range 1-65535

privacy.Description: Valid values are `public`, `private`, `hidden`. Public - Service is visible to all users and every user can subscribe instances and get access without approval. Private - Service is visible to all users, instances can be subscribed either by service owning tenant members or will require approval. Hidden - Service is not visible to any user except those who are part of tenant owning the service, instances can be subscribed only by service owning tenant members.

name.Description: Custom name for the current protocol

port.Description: Port number. Example `80`. Or protocol number when protocol == `ip`

portgroupid.Description: ID of Port Group. Use instead of port key

state.Description: State of the resource. Valid values are `enabled` or `disabled`

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage this acl

prefix.Description: Unique prefix for allocation, must not overlap with other allocations.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage subnets under this allocation.

allowasin.Description: Optionally allow number of occurrences of the own AS number in received prefix AS-path. Default value is `0`.

defaultoriginate.Description: Originate default route to current neighbor. Default value is `false`.

hardware.Description: Defines hardware for Layer-3 and BGP session termination. Valid value is hardware name or `auto` when BGP is terminated on VNet. Default value is `auto`.

inboundroutemap.Description: Reference to route-map resource. Valid value is route-map name.

localpreference.Description: BGP session local preference. Default value is `100`.

name.Description: User assigned name of BGP session.

outboundroutemap.Description: Reference to route-map resource. Valid value is route-map name.

portid.Description: Port ID where BGP neighbor cable is connected. Can't be used together `vnetid`.

prefixinboundmax.Description: BGP session will be interrupted if neighbor advertises more prefixes than defined. Equal to `1000` if BGP session is terminated on hardware type of switch.

prefixlistinbound.Description: List of inbound prefix list. Example `["deny 127.0.0.0/8 le 32", "permit 0.0.0.0/0 le 24"]`.

prefixlistoutbound.Description: List of outbound prefix list, if not defined autogenerated prefix list will apply which will permit defined allocations and assignments, and will deny all private addresses. Example `["permit 192.0.2.0/24 le 26"]`.

prependinbound.Description: Number of times to prepend self AS to as-path of received prefix advertisements. Default value is `0`.

prependoutbound.Description: Number of times to prepend self AS to as-path being advertised to neighbors. Default value is `0`.

sendbgpcommunity.Description: Send BGP Community Unconditionally advertise defined list of BGP communities towards BGP neighbor. Format: AA:NN Community number in AA:NN format (where AA and NN are (0-65535)) or local-AS. Example `["65501:777"]`.

siteid.Description: Site (data center) ID where this BGP session should be terminated on.

state.Description: Valid value is `enabled` or `disabled`; enabled - initiating and waiting for BGP connections, disabled - disable Layer-2 tunnel and Layer-3 address. Default value is `enabled`.

vlanid.Description: VLAN ID for tagging BGP neighbor facing ethernet frames. Valid values should be in range 2-4094.

vnetid.Description: Existing VNet service ID to terminate E-BGP on. Can't be used together `portid`.

weight.Description: BGP session weight. Default value is `0`.

name.Description: The name of the BGP Object

type.Description: BGP Objects type. Possible values: `ipv4`, `ipv6`, `aspath`, `community`, `extended`, `large`. Detailed documentation about objects types is available [here](https://www.netris.ai/docs/en/stable/network-policies.html#bgp-objects)

value.Description: Object value. For type `ipv4`, `ipv6` value can be multiline

mainip.Description: A unique IP address which will be used as a loopback address of this unit. Valid value is ip address (example `198.51.100.10`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign an ip address automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

siteid.Description: The site ID where this controller belongs.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.

customrule.Description: Custom Rules configuration block. User defined rules to allow certain traffic.

dstport.Description: Destination port. 1-65535, or empty for any.

srcport.Description: Source port. 1-65535, or empty for any.

dnsservers.Description: List of IP addresses of DNS servers. Example `["1.1.1.1", "8.8.8.8"]`

ipv4ssh.Description: List of IPv4 subnets allowed to ssh. Example `["10.0.10.0/24", "172.16.16.16"]`

ipv6ssh.Description: List of IPv6 subnets allowed to ssh. Example `["2001:DB8::/32"]`

ntpservers.Description: List of domain names or IP addresses of NTP servers. Example `["0.pool.ntp.org", "132.163.96.5"]`

timezone.Description: Devices using this inventory profile will adjust their system time to the selected timezone. Valid value is a name from the TZ [database](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones).

backend.Description: List of backends. Valid value is `ip`:`port` Example `["192.0.2.100:443", "192.0.2.101:443"]`

check.Description: A health check determines whether instances in the target pool are healthy. If protocol == `udp` then check.type should be `none`

frontend.Description: L4LB frontend IP. If not specified, will be assigned automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

port.Description: L4LB frontend port to be exposed

siteid.Description: The site ID. Resources defined in the selected site will be permitted to be used as backed entries for this L4 Load Balancer service.

state.Description: Administrative status. Possible values: `active` or `disable`. Default value is `active`

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.

dnattoip.Description: The internal IP address to which external hosts will gain access as a result of a DNAT translation. Only when action == `DNAT`

dnattoport.Description: The internal port to which external port will gain access as a result of a DNAT translation. Only when action == `DNAT`

dstaddress.Description: Match traffic destined to this subnet

dstport.Description: Match traffic destined to this port. Ignoring when protocol == `all` or `icmp`

name.Description: The unique name of NAT rule

siteid.Description: The site ID where this rule belongs

snattoip.Description: Replace the original address with the specified one. Only when action == `SNAT`

snattopool.Description: Replace the original address with the pool of ip addresses. Only when action == `SNAT`

srcaddress.Description: Match traffic sourced from this subnet

srcport.Description: Match traffic sourced from this port. Ignoring when protocol == `all` or `icmp`

state.Description: Rule state. Valid value is `enabled` or `disabled`. Default value is `enabled`.

autoneg.Description: Toggle auto negotiation. Possible values: `default`, `on`, `off`. Default value is `default`

breakout.Description: Toggle breakout. Possible values: `off`, `4x10`, `4x25`, `4x100`, `manual`. Default value is `off`

mtu.Description: MTU must be integer between 68 and 9216. Default value is `9000`

nodeid.Description: The node ID to whom this network interface belongs

speed.Description: Toggle interface speed, make sure that current node supports the configured speed. Possibe values: `auto`, `1g`, `10g`, `25g`, `40g`, `50g`, `100g`, `200g`, `400g`. Default value is `auto`

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage network interface

groups.Description: List of groups. Example: `["services.l4loadbalancer:view"]`. Possible action value is `view` or `edit`. Addition action value `external-acl` only for key `services.acl`

name.Description: The name of the Permission Group

autoneg.Description: Toggle auto negotiation. Possible values: `default`, `on`, `off`. Default value is `default`

breakout.Description: Toggle breakout. Possible values: `off`, `4x10`, `4x25`, `4x100`, `manual`. Default value is `off`

mtu.Description: MTU must be integer between 68 and 9216. Default value is `9000`

speed.Description: Toggle interface speed, make sure that current switch supports the configured speed. Possibe values: `auto`, `1g`, `10g`, `25g`, `40g`, `50g`, `100g`, `200g`, `400g`. Default value is `auto`

switchid.Description: The switch ID to whom this port belongs

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage port

name.Description: The name of the ACL Port Group

ports.Description: List of ports. Valid values are: single port `22`, range of ports `1024-2048`

inboundprefixlist.Description: List of additional prefixes that the ROH server may advertise. Only when type == `hypervisor`

name.Description: Instance name. If type == `hypervisor` the name must be the same as the hypervisor's hostname

routingprofile.Description: Possible values: `inherit`, `default`, `default_agg`, `full_table`. Default value is `inherit`. Detailed documentation about routing profiles is available [here](https://www.netris.ai/docs/en/stable/roh.html#adding-roh-hosts)

siteid.Description: The site ID where the current ROH instance belongs

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage instance

type.Description: Possible values: `physical` or `hypervisor` Physical Server, for all servers forming a BGP adjacency directly with the switch fabric. Hypervisor, for using the hypervisor as an interim router. Proxmox is currently the only supported hypervisor.

unicastips.Description: List of IPv4 addresses for the loopback interface.

hwids.Description: Hardware ID where to apply this route. It is typically used for Null routes. If not set, Netris will automatically decide where to apply

nexthop.Description: Traffic destined to the Prefix will be routed towards the Next-Hop. Note that static routes will be injected only on units that have the Next-Hop as a connected network

siteid.Description: The site ID where the current route belongs

state.Description: Administrative state of the route. Possible values: `enabled` or `disabled`. Default value is `enabled`

sequence.Description: The block of sequence. The sequence number will be assigned automatically

parameter.Description: The attribute to be manipulated. Possible values: `as_path`, `community`, `large_community`, `ipv4_next_hop`, `ipv6_next_hop`, `local_preference`, `med`, `origin`, `route_tag`, `weight`

type.Description: Define whether to manipulate a particular BGP attribute or go to another sequence. Possible values: `set`, `goto`, `next`

match.Description: Block of Rules for route matching.

objectid.Description: The ID of bgp object. Only for types: `as_path`, `community`, `extended_community`, `large_community`, `ipv4_prefix_list`, `ipv4_next_hop`, `route_source`, `ipv6_prefix_list`

type.Description: Type of the object to match: `as_path`, `community`, `extended_community`, `large_community`, `ipv4_prefix_list`, `ipv4_next_hop`, `route_source`, `ipv6_prefix_list`, `ipv6_next_hop`, `local_preference`, `med`, `origin`, `route_tag`

value.Description: Value of the object. Only for types: `ipv6_next_hop`, `local_preference`, `med`, `origin`, `route_tag`. Possible value for type `origin` is: `egp`, `incomplete`, `igp`

policy.Description: Permit or deny the routes which match below all match clauses within the current sequence. Possible values: `permit` or `deny`

acldefaultpolicy.Description: Possible values: `permit` or `deny`. Deny - Layer-3 packet forwarding is denied by default. ACLs are required to permit necessary traffic flows. Deny ACLs will be applied before Permit ACLs. Permit - Layer-3 packet forwarding is allowed by default. ACLs are required to deny unwanted traffic flows. Permit ACLs will be applied before Deny ACLs.

publicasn.Description: Site public ASN that should be used for external bgp peer configuration

rohasn.Description: ASN for ROH (Routing on the Host) compute instances, should be unique within the scope of a site, can be same for different sites

rohroutingprofile.Description: ROH Routing profile defines set of routing prefixes to be advertised to ROH instances. Possible values: `default`, `default_agg`, `full`. Default route only - Will advertise 0.0.0.0/0 + loopback address of physically connected switch. Default + Aggregate - Will add prefixes of defined subnets + `Default` profile. Full - Will advertise all prefixes available in the routing table of the connected switch

sitemesh.Description: Site to site VPN mode. Site mesh available values are: `disabled`, `hub`, `spoke`, `dspoke`

vmasn.Description: ASN for ROH (Routing on the Host) virtual compute instances, should be unique within the scope of a site, can be same for different sites

mainip.Description: A unique IP address which will be used as a loopback address of this unit. Valid value is ip address (example `198.51.100.11`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign an ip address automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

mgmtip.Description: A unique IP address to be used on out of band management interface. Valid value is ip address (example `192.0.2.11`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign an ip address automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

profileid.Description: An inventory profile ID to define global configuration (NTP, DNS, timezone, etc...)

siteid.Description: The site ID where this softgate belongs.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.

defaultgateway.Description: Use when purpose is set to `management`.

prefix.Description: Unique prefix for subnet, must not overlap with other subnets.

purpose.Description: Describes which kind of service will be able to use this subnet. Possible values: `common`, `loopback`, `management`, `load-balancer`, `nat`, `inactive`

siteids.Description: List of sites IDs where this subnet is available.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage the subnet.

asnumber.Description: Switch AS numbers. Valid value is ASN (example `420000002`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign automatically from `System ASN range`

mainip.Description: A unique IP address which will be used as a loopback address of this unit. Valid value is ip address (example `198.51.100.21`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign an ip address automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

mgmtip.Description: A unique IP address to be used on out of band management interface. Valid value is ip address (example `192.0.2.21`) or `auto`. If set `auto` the controller will assign an ip address automatically from subnets with relevant purpose.

portcount.Description: Preliminary port count is used for definition of topology. Possible values: `16`, `32`, `48`, `54`, `56`

profileid.Description: An inventory profile ID to define global configuration (NTP, DNS, timezone, etc...)

siteid.Description: The site ID where this switch belongs.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.

company.Description: Company the user works for. Usually useful for multi-tenant systems where the company provides Netris Controller access to customers.

email.Description: The email address of the user. Also used for system notifications and for password retrieval.

emailcc.Description: Send copies of email notifications to this address.

pgroup.Description: Name of Permission Group. User permissions for viewing and editing parts of the Netris Controller. (if User Role is not used).

tenants.Description: List of tenants. (if User Role is not used).

userrole.Description: Name of User Role. When using a User Role object to define RBAC (role-based access control), `pgroup` and `tenants` fields will be ignoring.

name.Description: The name of the user role.

pgroup.Description: The name of existing permission group

sites.Description: Block of per site vnet configuration

prefix.Description: The address will be serving as anycast default gateway for selected subnet. Example: `203.0.113.1/25`

id.Description: The site ID. Ports from these sites will be allowed to participate in the V-Net. (Multi-site vnet would require backbone connectivity between sites).

lacp.Description: LAG mode. Allows for active-standby dual-homing, assuming LAG configuration on the remote end. Valid value is `on` or `off`. Default value is `off`.

vlanid.Description: VLAN tag for current port. If vlanid is not set - means port untagged

lacp.Description: LAG mode. Allows for active-standby dual-homing, assuming LAG configuration on the remote end. Valid value is `on` or `off`. Default value is `off`.

vlanid.Description: VLAN tag for current port. If vlanid is not set - means port untagged

state.Description: V-Net state. Allowed values: `active` or `disabled`. Default value is `active`

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.

name.Description: The name of the BGP Object

type.Description: BGP Objects type. Detailed documentation about objects types is available [here](https://www.netris.ai/docs/en/stable/network-policies.html#bgp-objects)

customrule.Description: Custom Rules configuration block. User defined rules to allow certain traffic.

dstport.Description: Destination port. 1-65535, or empty for any.

srcport.Description: Source port. 1-65535, or empty for any.

dnsservers.Description: List of IP addresses of DNS servers.

ipv4ssh.Description: List of IPv4 subnets allowed to ssh.

ipv6ssh.Description: List of IPv6 subnets allowed to ssh.

ntpservers.Description: List of domain names or IP addresses of NTP servers.

timezone.Description: Devices using this inventory profile will adjust their system time to the selected timezone. Valid value is a name from the TZ [database](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones).

mtu.Description: MTU must be integer between 68 and 9216.

nodeid.Description: The node ID to whom this network interface belongs

speed.Description: Toggle interface speed, make sure that current node supports the configured speed.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage network interface

mtu.Description: MTU must be integer between 68 and 9216.

speed.Description: Toggle interface speed, make sure that current switch supports the configured speed.

switchid.Description: The switch ID to whom this port belongs

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to manage port

sites.Description: Block of per site vnet configuration.

prefix.Description: The address will be serving as anycast default gateway for selected subnet.

id.Description: The site ID. Ports from these sites will be allowed to participate in the V-Net.

tenantid.Description: ID of tenant. Users of this tenant will be permitted to edit this unit.
